body:
One member per group, submit with group name + list members’ names
Capture everything that went on with the team this semester
 
1. Git Repositories
2. Report of ticketing (export git issues tickets)
3. Look at all servers (15 VMs) → give all information to get the servers up and running; might need an excel sheet or database to store all information
        3a. VM specs
        3b. operating system spec
        3c. users
        3d. versions of things needed to be installed
        3e. User permissions needed
        3f. Literally anything else (he went through this list of examples very quickly, but it needs anything relevant to setting up the servers)
4. Relevant chats

body:
While testing on the Frontend deployment flow, we found that we needed to send two bundle/install requests for the installer script to actually catch the second message. It would almost always miss the first message.

Today, I tested the DMZ deployment flow and found the same error, where the first install request is never processed by install_bundle.php.

body:
Create a shell script that uses tar.gz to bundle a file.

Flow : 
dev vm runs ./bundle.sh {bundlename} {filepath}
-> bundle.sh calls bundle.php to send request to Deploy VM
-> deploy VM checks version number + updates table with name, filepath, and more
-> bundle.sh scp's file into Deploy VM

comments.body:
Bundle Script Drafted --> test_bundle.sh + test_bundle.php + receive_bundle.php
Was able to test between DMZ to backend to test that it bundle and sends the files to the remote server.

Need to see what files will need to be bundled together + how the installation scripts will work ??

Filepaths JSON file created. Tested that bundle.php was able to SCP files into deployment while maintaining the folder hierarchy. Need to create another JSON file for installation scripts (?) + "processes to bounce". Also need to cat? nano? the installation scripts listed in the json file with the tar somehow ? Mostly developed on branch "Rea"

Re-tested on each dev vm. All backend/frontend/dmz vms are able to send bundles to the deploy queue + deploy is able to receive. Created new version of bundleconfig.json with paths and commands per bundle name type.

Updated configure.sh creation with commands listed in json. file looks fine but installation scripts may need more debugging.

(need to check: should configure be deleted after it is ran?)

Tested dev frontend > deploy > QA and bundling also worked. Need to work on install scripts + updating all daemon filepaths and host.ini with "sed" commands in the "commands" attribute of the bundleconfig.json.

Added special sudo rules for aarc-qa users and made sure that aarc-qa owns the folders we are accessing remotely. All hostnames and users are updated in QA and deployment VM. Frontend was able to receive and successfully install bundle but Install script needs to be updated for Backend and DMZ.
Updated bundleconfig to include all log files and daemon files.

body: Clean up API/DMZ files for easier bundle updates later on

comments.body:
Redrafted almost all of the api functions

Broke it down into api_cache (internal database), api_endpoints (cURL to endpoints), and api_process (processes data from API) scripts. 
Library_API listener only listens for requests and has "require_once" for api_process. 
api_process requires api_cache and api_endpoints

Would probably be easier if we used composer to keep all configs/dependencies but not necessary (hopefully).

Recommendation system NOT overhauled yet. Need to test everything first.
Recommendation system overhauled + tested. Need to test/troubleshoot once dev vms are up, but appears to be working !

comments.body:
learning through trial and error with qa what exactly we need to do and in what order for prod. 
things include:
- join zerotier network for the cluster
- changing hostname with 'sudo hostnamectl set-hostname (new hostname)' and in /etc/hosts for consistency between clusters/vms and to make routing bundles less of a headache
- creating a generic user for qa and prod clusters for the same reason above
- setting up an ssh key with deployment
- using rabbitmq setup script after hostname is changed
- cleaning filepaths to work with deployment logic
- update firewalls for cluster ips

milestone.title: Midterm Project
milestone.description:
Authentication & Midterm Project Common Deliverables

Here are the common deliverables that ALL midterm projects must have.  I need to stress here that this is only HALF of the grade for the midterm project.  After you demonstrate that your group has Authentication working We will discuss your group proposal and you will be assigned just as many GROUP deliverables.  Together all 12 make up the grade for your midterm project.

The Common Midterm Deliverables:

    Functional Web Site / Server
    Secured Database - NO REMOTE ACCESS TO IT
    Inter-Server Communication through a message Queue
    Data Collection through Code (Cron / on demand)
    Firewalls (with at least SOME reject rules)
    Authentication
PERSONAL MIDTERM DELIVERABLES

Search by author, title, browse books, and see details on individuals books

Rate and review books

Build personal library

Build recommendation system based on user preferences

Create book clubs + invite others 

Let people schedule club events (may need calendar API as well)

title: create rmq listener for club functions

body: Recommend books based on books in library. Could be done by genre, reading level, or author?

comments.body:
didn't get to draft this yet, but I'm thinking we could recommend books based on any 2 subject keys match? send a query to the API and API listener for books where there are matching subject keys.

query = subject_keyA and subject_keyB
openlibraryapilink.com/search.json?q=subject_keyA&&subject_keyB&limit=5

something like that? since the subject keys are full jsons, we could randomize which one it gets?




for reference of cache db columns:
  subject_key JSON DEFAULT NULL,
  person_key JSON DEFAULT NULL,
  place_key JSON DEFAULT NULL,
  time_key JSON DEFAULT NULL,

focused on general subjects for recommendation system. Made a 2-subject match (minimum) for recommending books. It randomizes which subject it uses for the /subjects/ api endpoint, so there might not be a recommendation each time. It's a 1-to-1 recommendation as of right now. It works, but could use tweaking probably.
Need to add weights to genres found in the user's stored books !

Revised recommendation system to use weighted scores. **NEED TO VERIFY IT WORKS once all dev branches are updated**

normalizes the frequency of subjects found from a person's library with (frequency of subject) / (amount of books present in library).

scaled the weights of the scores by factor of 5.

uses top subject with highest weighted score as the base subject when accessing subjects.json

https://www.kaggle.com/code/rafaymemon/building-recommendation-system-weighted-average
https://global.php.cn/faq/536741.html
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/maths/weighted-average-formula/
https://medium.com/@zaiinn440/one-stop-guide-for-production-recommendation-systems-9491f68d92e3
Tested on 11/15 again and it works!

title: Recommendation System

body: Search the library + display books to browse.

comments.body: Tested search functions but had to rewrite after changing the way the API works. Need to also test that the books are clickable links that redirect to the individual book detail page.

Removed "search.json?author=" search method. Only focusing on q= query types (which are title/keyword queries. generally works with author names but may not be as accurate, but it works for the time being).

Working on recentBooks cache and updating. Might need a proper "browse" page, but idk how to go about that because the library_cache will be overpopulated very quickly ? Need to consult prof.

EX.) https://openlibrary.org/search.json?q=*&sort=new&limit=20&page=4
maybe this data doesnt need to be cached into the API unless the user clicks on it ?

Clickable links work and details are displaying properly (if not blank. may not work well with new books). Browsing also works via search.json, which offers a page parameter already. Showed to professor as of 10/23 and approved.

Troubleshooting personal library. Was able to view library when one book is in the personal library, but unable to load when there are more than one books in their library.

Found the issue --> rabbitMQLib.inc send_request was missing closing channel and conn. Resulted in 2 consumers and 1 acknowledged messages. Added closing channel and conn statements and it worked! It is able to list all books in a person's library now.

Relevant Commits:
_Fixing Hidden Bug_
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/d52ecc2268b9f183dff3bd9c6923927dcaa489ee
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/3d127abdc6e3542c6d17555f7d59c6e9cce65693

_Recommendation System_
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/885cfbfa32b441960ef5ae50a4eaa455f0074422
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/47c2328dd8fbd0114cf1e03ca1d8c75192074f3c

milestone.title: Midterm Project
milestone.description:
Authentication & Midterm Project Common Deliverables

Here are the common deliverables that ALL midterm projects must have.  I need to stress here that this is only HALF of the grade for the midterm project.  After you demonstrate that your group has Authentication working We will discuss your group proposal and you will be assigned just as many GROUP deliverables.  Together all 12 make up the grade for your midterm project.

The Common Midterm Deliverables:

    Functional Web Site / Server
    Secured Database - NO REMOTE ACCESS TO IT
    Inter-Server Communication through a message Queue
    Data Collection through Code (Cron / on demand)
    Firewalls (with at least SOME reject rules)
    Authentication
PERSONAL MIDTERM DELIVERABLES

Search by author, title, browse books, and see details on individuals books

Rate and review books

Build personal library

Build recommendation system based on user preferences

Create book clubs + invite others 

Let people schedule club events (may need calendar API as well)

body:
Need to make sure to cache API calls on client's machine when accessing API information.

Client makes request -> Webserver checks local cache -> if cache has it loaded already, return the loaded info || if cache doesnt have it loaded, sent request to RMQ > API Listener

comments.body: Set up caching on my VM but needs testing with @Cae6 's webserver VM + my API VM setup.
Tested with everyone's clones + reworking caches to be on the API VM's database instead of a webserver/frontend cache.

Fixed data encoding issues while troubleshooting issues on VM clones. Need to test it with everyone else present.

API VM's apidb (api database) was created and is only locally accessible. API listener checks its private db cache for request data. The db is only ever updated when a client requests new API info or needs to update an existing entry. Data appears to properly be received, checked in the private db cache, and call API to update private db before sending the info back to the queue.

Reworked library_cache because it previously stored the entire json doc for the api's doc. updated it to have singular columns per field for the doc. Needs testing again but the vpn/vm clone connectivity isnt working
Need to update library_cache calls in api listener. Realized Open Library doesn't actually list the subjects, rating, or isbn in search.json despite having it in its github documentation.....

Need to use the OLID from search.json to call ...

https://openlibrary.org/works/OL45804W.json
- for subject [ ]

https://openlibrary.org/works/OL45804W/editions.json
- for isbn_13



might remove "publisher" field because this depends on the edition.

library_cache is functional. Takes data from different endpoints depending on OLID. Worked for both Rea and Chizzy's code testing.

Used Rea-Testing for development

Commits on Rea branch:

_Parameter Bug Fix for Library Cache_
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/b96d7727f23ddbe1e0dddc6ec6f107e047bf9e41

_Updated All Files with Working API_
https://github.com/aksihombing/IT490-AARC/commit/77876a09b732c188743f91d86264d7eabbbc2f90

body:
**library.direct**: for all of the features related to retreiving data, rating and recommending books. exchange will be used with db and dmz?
**club .direct**: for all of the features related to the book clubs and their events for the db vm only bcs all data should already be local? 
**api.direct**

dmz (api/cache) will consume:
library.search: searches for book titles and authors go through here. uses cache first / 
library.details / 
library.collect: nightly cron collection for recent books section cache communicates through here /
api.get

db will consume:
library.recommend: recommendations based on users genres/history will return through this / 
library.rate: adding/updating user book ratings / 
library.review: adding/updating user text reviews / 
library.personal: management of users personal libraries 
club.create / 
club.invite / 
club.events.create / 
club.events.list / 
club.events.cancel
